solution.text:
Initial principal (P) = Rs._{{j*10000}}_.
Time Period(T) = 3 Years
Rate of Interest = _{k}_ %
Hence by formula of compound interest, Amount = P x (1+(R/100))^T
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, Amount due of loan after 3 years = _{{j*10000}}_ x (1+(_{k}_/100))^3 = Rs. _{{Decimal(j)*10000*(((100+Decimal(k))/100)**3)}}_

content.text: Find the amount due on a loan of Rs. _{{j*10000}}_ if the interest is _{k}_% compounded annually after 3 years.
